sentence.text: Squamous cell carcinoma (negative regulation of peptidase activity) is the most common cancer of the equine eye, frequently originating at the limbus, with the potential to invade the cornea, cause visual impairment, and result in loss of the eye.

Pedigree analysis in the Haflinger breed supports a positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II recessive mode of inheritance and a genome-wide association study (N = 23) identified a 1.5 Mb locus on ECA12 significantly associated with limbal SCC (P<sub>corrected</sub> = 0.04).

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Furthermore, in humans xeroderma pigmentosum complementation group E, a disease characterized by sun sensitivity and increased risk of cutaneous SCC and melanomas, is explained by mutations in protein polyubiquitination.
